I wish people would do a little research before giving one star reviews.
Like “Claudia H” and "Raoul" said you need the original game (hint gog.com)
and you need to copy the game files into “/$home/.d2x-rebirth”
this apply s to Descent 1 as well “/$home/.d1x-rebirth”
Then it works great with high rez textures, everything else is as the game was in 1994 and 1995.
Happy hunting.

Go to dxx-rebirth.com for the details, but the short of it is that this is a remake of the original Descent--engine--and NOT the original game!

You need to already own a copy of the game (either the original CD or from a reseller like GOG). If you run the program it'll create a hidden folder in your home directory called ".d1x-rebirth" where you can copy the original game files. All of your save data is held there too so backup accordingly.

My brother-in-law pointed me to this engine just a few years after the project was started and it has always run flawlessly on every Linux machine I've had. It's well put together, and it's wonderful to play Descent at a good frame rate in hi-res (unlike how I had to play it back in the 90s).
summary: Fantastic remake of the game engine!
